result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly W. McClone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
14CF173, 15CF10,15CF33, 14TR2021, 14TR2023, 15TR337, & 15TR383. Defendant Kelly W. McClone in court with attorney Jonas Bednarek.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record. Attorney Bednarek concurs. State moves to withdraw the motion to forfeit bond. Preliminary hearing discussed on all matters. Defedant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaints, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed on each matter. Attorney Bednarek confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1 of 14CF173. No Contest to Count 1 in 15CF10. No Contest to Count 1 in 15CF33. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 15CF10 & Count 2 of 15CF33. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF173, Count 2 in 15CF10, Counts 3 & 4 in 15CF33 along with 14TR2021, 14TR2023, 15TR337 & 15TR383. Sentencing argument by Attorney Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Bednarek. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 
14CF173: 9 months WCJ, with Huber but No Good Time Credit. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 1 day credit.

15CF10: 3 years Wisconsin State Prison, to be served as 1 years Initial Confinement & 2 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 6 days. Concurrent to 14CF173. CONDITIONS: $2500 fine inclusive of costs,plus a $42.50 blood draw fee, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 36 month DL revocation, 36 month IID, OWI assessment. Absolute sobriety, No bars, not to possess/ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription. Maintain full time employment. Terms of Agent. 

15CF33: 4 years Wisconsin State Prison, to be served as 18 month Initial Confinement and 30 month Extended supervision. Consecutive to 15CF10. Credit for 56 days.  CONDITIONS: $3000 fine inclusive of costs, plus a $42.50 blood draw fee, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 36 month DL revocation, 36 month IID, OWI assessment. Absolute sobriety, No bars, not to possess/ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription. Maintain full time employment. Terms of Agent. Appeal Rights Given.

Motion hearing at 03-20-2015 02:45 pm

14CF173 & 15CF10 Cases called @ 2:12 p.m. Defendant Kelly W. Mcclone in court with attorney Jonas Bednarek.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF173 - Statement by Atty Bednarek regarding the motion to forfeit bond. The court will hold in abeyance determination on the motion to forfeit bond which will track along with the proceedings. 15CF10- Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:35 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:15 PM: Defendant Kelly W. McClone in court with attorney Jonas Bednarek.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Atty Bednarek speaks as to charging of felonious conduct with 9 mos felony - anomoly in law. Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits.   Att Bednarek is prepared to argue for bond conversion to Signature.  Court declines to amend bond - previous cash bond to continue.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 09:25 am.

from Atty Benarek Re: Adjournment of IA on 12/16/14 due to conflict - Request granted by the Court
Initial appearance on December 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant appeared in court-warrant not signed.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

3:20 pm case called. Defendant Kelly W. McClone in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint stated-reading waived. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant has contacted an attorney. Court withdraws warrant, withdraws bond forfeiture and withdraws default judgment on 14TR2021 & 14TR2023.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
UNSIGNED

Defendant Kelly W. McClone not in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Riverside Ruling. Court issues a warrant, within adjacent states. Court orders bond forfeited. Court default judgment of 14TR2021 & 14TR2023, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.
